intro: Schleidenia linifolia, commonly known as the silkyleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, silvery-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. Schleidenia linifolia is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
